alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 7:13PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee, northeastern Phillips, northeastern Coahoma, Tunica and northern Quitman Counties through 745 PM CST... At 713 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Helena-West Helena, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Tunica, Crenshaw, Sledge, Lexa, Dubbs, North Tunica, Dundee, Little Texas, Lula, Lagrange, Gerlach Mill, Moon, Preston Place, Quarles, Austin, Jeffries, Wycamp and Latour. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
